snippet: As the U.S. dispatches advisers to Iraq, the police of Nineveh Province, who have experience in battling the jihadists, have been largely abandoned.
abstract: Iraqi police in Nineveh Province find themselves largely abandoned in fighting Islamic State militants because Shiite-led government is fearful region's police officers, who are primarily Sunni, will sell weapons to jihadists or, worse, join them.

byline.contributor: Omar al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: As the U.S. dispatches advisers to Iraq, the police of Nineveh Province, who have experience in battling the jihadists, have been largely abandoned.

headline.main: A Force to Fight ISIS Has Manpower, but Little Firepower
headline.print_headline: A Force to Fight ISIS Has Manpower, but Little Firepower

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
